captions.text: Eyes on me!  Good!
I say we eat him.
*chomp*
Now now!  No Eating.
Remember.  We're like a family.
But I really want to eat your face!

Hehe.  Well I am popular now, so that's
understandable.
You think your're so cool don't you!
Who do you think you are?  Indiana Jones?
Yeah!  Who do you think you are?!
Nobody's saying that!  Come on girls.
Why are you in a Spielberg production then?
Yeah!  How come?
Even dressed kinda like him.
When did you even watch Indiana Jones?
Can we... Can we just get back to the training?
Who wants to learn to jump through hoops?
I say we eat 'em. Yes!  Works for me!
Whoa! Girls girls girls!  If you eat me...
who's gonna take you on motorcycle walks?
WooooHoooo!
Ahaahahahahaha!
This is so fun!
WooHoooo!
*CHOMP*
Nobody eats the Pratt Pratt, except me!
*chuckles*
See you real soon.

comments.author: PlushQueen

comments.text:
Chris Pratt: You may eat me, but you'll never leave the island!

Raptor (with pipe): I beg to differ. You see our pack have already learned 
how to open up doors, handle your weapons, use computers and invented a 
futuristic language (LOLZ!). We have communicated with your National Guard 
to come and save you but we will commandeer their boat, invade other 
countries and perpetuate our species. (smiling from eye to eye) But perhaps 
I have said too much. (puffs on pipe)

Chris Pratt (in disbelief): Clever girl.﻿

comments.text:
An idea for one scene for the How Jurassic World Should Have Ended.

They're about to go into the iRex's paddock. 
Then the 'Here's a Bright Idea' Guy appears.

"Here's a bright idea: how about we spray paint the whole paddock due to 
the fact she can camouflage just to be sure she's not there before we send 
people in without her ripping one shreds and escapes."

They did and reveals the iRex, security tightens, and she snaps her fingers 
when her plot of escape has been foiled. ﻿

comments.author: Red

comments.text:
As long as the series is continuing, I think feathered dinosaurs (to 
highlight Dino's undermined relationship with birds) and/or the long term 
effects of numerous escaped dinos (from the obviously dangerous predators 
for the action scenes to the suprisingly harmful herbivores that would 
overgraze the land and threaten its competitors and therefore the 
ecosystem's stability) as a relative invasive species could make cool new 
elements that we haven't seen before. Now Given the trailers, I doubt the 
latter would make it into much if any of the next one, but this is all 
hypothetical for when Hollywood eventually decides to give to yet another 
sequel.﻿

comments.text:
have you guys thought that perhaps the raptors are only not attacking him 
in the trailer perhaps because they see the new hybrid dinosaur creature as 
a bigger enemy than a lone human? perhaps they are thinking oh hey we have 
a mutual enemy! lets work together now!!! or maybe they see it as a threat 
to their dominance in their territory so they decide to ignore a lone 
human, they are very intelligent after all. humans are capable of banding 
up against a common enemy, even if said humans were enemies before the 
arrival of a new threat, so why not raptors? i mean they are rather 
intelligent based off what i have seen in the movies and read in the JP 
books. just saying all this to get this possibility into all of your minds 
:D﻿
